p: Three non-phenolic diarylheptanoids from C. xanthorrhiza, namely, trans, trans-1,7-diphenyl-1,3-heptadien-4-one (alnustone) ( Figure 1), trans-1,7-diphenyl-1-hepten-5-ol, and trans, trans-1,7-diphenyl-1,3-heptadien-5-ol have demonstrated potential anti-inflammatory activity in carrageenan-induced hind paw edema in rats [ 54, 55], where the non-phenolic linear 1,7-diarylheptanoids were proposed to represent a novel class of topical anti-inflammatory agents ( Table 2) [ 56].
